optimization_framework.description: Core optimization framework - primary module for compiler passes and optimizations
strengths: Expected module for calling other modules
optimization_framework.recommendation: No changes needed. Maintain as foundational architecture module.

compilation_pipeline.description: Compilation pipeline orchestration - manages phases and stages
compilation_pipeline.recommendation: No changes needed. Well-designed module with appropriate responsibilities.

strengths: Primary dependency on optimization_framework is appropriate
Receives expected callbacks from core module
register_allocation.recommendation: Acceptable. Minor audit recommended to verify function allocation aligns with register allocation scope.

architecture_detection.description: Target architecture detection and capability analysis
issues: High incoming calls (341 total) from multiple modules
Some functions may be utilities rather than architecture-specific
architecture_detection.recommendation: AUDIT function allocation. Verify all functions truly relate to architecture detection. Consider splitting if utility functions are mixed in.

ptx_emission.description: PTX instruction emission and code generation
issues: 292 outgoing calls to optimization_framework suggests utility overlap
Some functions may be helper utilities rather than PTX-specific
ptx_emission.recommendation: AUDIT function allocation. Reduce external dependencies. May need to move utility functions or consolidate with optimization_framework.

critical_issues: Receives 1,310 incoming calls (2ND HIGHEST in codebase)
Scope appears too broad - may mix error reporting + warnings + diagnostics
error_handling.recommendation: HIGH PRIORITY: Audit all functions to verify they are error-related. Consider splitting into separate modules: (1) error_reporting, (2) warnings/diagnostics, (3) message_formatting. Goal: reduce incoming calls from 1,310 to <200.

critical_issues: 71.2% of function calls are EXTERNAL (catastrophic design flaw)
Only 104 functions but heavily scattered across codebase
418 calls to optimization_framework (4x more than internal calls)
Suggests severe misclassification - many functions likely belong elsewhere
tensor_core_codegen.recommendation: CRITICAL PRIORITY: Immediate manual code review of all 104 functions. Reclassify to correct modules: (1) Tensor-specific optimization passes → optimization_framework, (2) Tensor instruction selection → instruction_selection, (3) Tensor register allocation → register_allocation. Consolidate and create clear module boundaries.

instruction_selection.description: Instruction selection and DAG pattern matching
critical_issues: Acts as utility module, NOT instruction selection module
Severely over-broad scope mixing utilities with selection logic
1,800+ incoming calls indicates functions are shared helpers, not selection-specific
instruction_selection.recommendation: CRITICAL PRIORITY: Split immediately into two modules. (1) core_instruction_selection (focused, <20 functions), (2) instruction_infrastructure (utilities, helpers, builders). Move 1,634 calls worth of functions from optimization_framework usage to appropriate modules. Goal: reduce incoming calls to <100.
instruction_selection.priority: CRITICAL (MAY HAVE LARGER IMPACT THAN TENSOR_CORE)
instruction_selection.analysis: The 1,634 calls from optimization_framework strongly indicate these are NOT instruction-selection-specific functions. Likely categories: helper functions, common infrastructure, data structure builders, query functions.

tensor_core_codegen.root_cause: Too many functions misclassified - 71.2% of calls go to other modules
tensor_core_codegen.impact: Code organization nightmare - tensor core functions scattered across codebase
tensor_core_codegen.action_required: Manual review and reclassification of all 104 functions
tensor_core_codegen.expected_benefit: Consolidate tensor core codegen into cohesive unit with 60%+ cohesion

instruction_selection.root_cause: Acting as utility module with 1,800+ incoming calls from optimization_framework
instruction_selection.impact: Module serves dual purpose - confuses actual instruction selection with helpers
instruction_selection.action_required: Split into core instruction selection (small) + infrastructure utilities
instruction_selection.expected_benefit: Clear separation of concerns, easier maintenance, better code organization

error_handling.root_cause: Likely mixing error reporting + diagnostics + message formatting
error_handling.impact: 1,246 calls from optimization_framework suggest heavy coupling
error_handling.action_required: Audit scope and consider splitting into 3 modules
error_handling.expected_benefit: Reduced dependencies, clearer error handling architecture

ptx_emission.root_cause: 292 calls to optimization_framework suggest some utility function overlap
ptx_emission.action_required: Audit functions, verify PTX-specific vs. generic utilities

architecture_detection.root_cause: High incoming calls (341) suggest utility functions may be mixed in
architecture_detection.impact: Unclear what makes a function 'architecture detection'

reclassification_plan.reason: 40% coverage of PTX keywords indicates PTX emission focus
22.2% coverage of instruction selection keywords (MMA patterns)
22.2% coverage of architecture detection keywords (sm_* patterns)

wiki_validation.interpretation: Only 55/90 wiki-verified functions were correctly classified. Many unknown modules have wiki verification but aren't classified.
wiki_validation.key_finding: Unknown functions may be recoverable from wiki data - future improvement opportunity

classification_confidence.interpretation: All classified functions have low confidence (0.165-0.168), suggesting keyword-based classification only
classification_confidence.note: No high/medium confidence functions indicates weakness in classification methodology

healthy_pattern.description: Low outgoing calls indicates core module

unknown_functions.recommendation: Consider binary analysis or additional heuristics to classify

immediate_actions.title: CRITICAL: Refactor tensor_core_codegen module
steps: Manual code review of all 104 functions in tensor_core_codegen
Categorize by actual purpose (optimization pass vs. instruction selection vs. register allocation)
Move functions to appropriate modules (optimization_framework, instruction_selection, register_allocation)
Verify no orphaned functions remain
Create clear module boundaries and documentation
Run full test suite to verify correctness
immediate_actions.success_criteria: Cohesion increases above 60%, external call percentage drops below 30%
immediate_actions.testing: All tests must pass, performance unchanged

immediate_actions.title: CRITICAL: Split instruction_selection module
steps: Identify core instruction selection functions (estimate <20 functions)
Create new 'instruction_infrastructure' module for utilities
Move helper functions, builders, query functions to infrastructure module
Move optimization_framework calls (1,634 total) to appropriate target modules
Update all call sites with new module references
Document instruction selection interface clearly
Run full test suite

immediate_actions.title: HIGH: Audit and potentially split error_handling module
steps: Review all 531 functions in error_handling module
Verify each function is truly error-related
Identify functions that are warnings/diagnostics (vs. errors)
Consider splitting into error_reporting, warnings/diagnostics, message_formatting
Reduce optimization_framework dependency (currently 1,246 calls)
Document error handling scope and API
Update call sites if split occurs
immediate_actions.risk: MEDIUM - affects error reporting throughout compiler
immediate_actions.testing: Error handling tests must remain comprehensive

medium_priority_actions.title: MEDIUM: Audit architecture_detection module boundaries
steps: Review 177 functions for architecture-specific relevance
Identify any utility functions that should be moved
Verify cross-module dependencies are appropriate
Document what makes a function 'architecture_detection'
Update as needed

medium_priority_actions.title: MEDIUM: Audit ptx_emission module boundaries
steps: Review 647 functions for PTX-specific relevance
Identify any generic utilities that should be in optimization_framework
Verify 292 calls to optimization_framework are appropriate
Document PTX emission scope
Consider consolidation if many generic functions exist

medium_priority_actions.title: MEDIUM: Apply recommended reclassifications
steps: Apply 9 recommended function reclassifications from this report
Start with MEDIUM confidence items (functions 0x12c8dd0, 0x1221570, 0x3024a30)
Then apply LOW confidence items
Update all references and verify tests pass
Document rationale for each reclassification

longer_term_improvements: Implement automated cohesion monitoring (alert if any module drops below 60%)
Create detailed module interface contracts and dependency documentation
Develop better classification methodology beyond keyword matching
Consider using binary analysis for unknown functions
Implement module dependency graph visualization for ongoing monitoring
Create module refactoring checklist for future changes
Establish coding standards for module boundaries and responsibilities
Implement call graph analysis as part of CI/CD pipeline
avoid_mistakes: Do NOT move functions without understanding their full call graph
Do NOT ignore test failures during refactoring - they indicate breaking changes
Do NOT refactor multiple critical modules in parallel - do sequentially
Do NOT assume 'utility' functions are safe to move - verify all callers
Do NOT ignore circular dependencies - they often indicate design issues
Do NOT apply reclassifications without measuring cohesion before/after
Do NOT forget to update documentation when moving functions
Do NOT make changes during feature freeze or critical release cycles

consolidation_notes.data_quality: HIGH - all source files consistent with findings
next_steps: Present findings to architecture review team
Schedule manual code review sessions for tensor_core_codegen and instruction_selection
Create detailed refactoring plan with timeline
Set up monitoring for module cohesion metrics
Document all changes with ADRs (Architecture Decision Records)
consolidation_notes.contact_information: Architecture team responsible for compilation pipeline optimization
